data: Restricted to Department of Palliative Care
Physician to review all previous opioid and CNS depressant orders
Ongoing analgesic and adjuvant management by Palliative Care physician
q1h for 4 hour then q4h and PRN until ketamine infusion completed
q1h for 4 hour then q4h and PRN until ketamine infusion completed
q1h for 4 hour then q4h and PRN until ketamine infusion completed

Assess for dysphoric symptoms (delusions, unpleasant dreams, hallucinations) q4h while awake and if present, give LORazepam OR oxazepam. If dysphoric symptoms persist, stop infusion and page Palliative Care Physician

If pain not controlled within 24 hours, please discontinue previous ketamine order and order ketamine titratable infusion (5mg/h) standard  with 5 mg/h minimum rate, 15mg/h maximum rate with Titrate Instructions: If pain not controlled, increase by 5 mg/h q24h, with order duration of 48 hours

sodium chloride 0.9% premix: Volume dose: 50, volume dose unit: mL
Free text rate: Titrate, Route of Administration: subcutaneous, minimum rate,  _____ mg/mL, maximum rate,  _____ mg/mL

sodium chloride 0.9% premix: Volume dose: 50, volume dose unit: mL
Free text rate: Titrate, Route of Administration: IV, minimum rate,  _____ mg/mL, maximum rate,  _____ mg/mL
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, sublingual, q8h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab-sublingual
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, subcutaneous, q8h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, subcutaneous, q6h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
